verses.kjv: Concerning the Ammonites, thus saith the LORD; Hath Israel no sons? hath he no heir? why then doth their king inherit Gad, and his people dwell in his cities?
verses.web: Of the children of Ammon. LORD says: “Has Israel no sons? Has he no heir? Why then does Malcam possess Gad, and his people dwell in its cities?
verses.ct: This message is about the Ammonites. The LORD says: "Does Israel have no sons? Does he have no heir? Then why has their king taken over Gad, and why do his people live in its cities?

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Therefore behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard against Rabbah of the children of Ammon; and it will become a desolate heap, and her daughters will be burned with fire: then Israel will possess those who possessed him,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Because of this, the days are coming," says the LORD, "when I will sound the battle cry against Rabbah of the Ammonites. It will become a pile of ruins, and its surrounding towns will be burned to the ground. Then Israel will reclaim the land from those who took it from him," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.
verses.web: “Wail, Heshbon, for Ai is laid waste! Cry, you daughters of Rabbah! Clothe yourself in sackcloth. Lament, and run back and forth among the fences; for Malcam will go into captivity, his priests and his princes together.
verses.ct: "Wail, Heshbon, because Ai has been destroyed! Cry out, women of Rabbah! Put on sackcloth and mourn! Run back and forth among the walls, because your king will be dragged into exile — he and his priests and officials together.

verses.kjv: Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me?
verses.web: Why do you boast in the valleys, your flowing valley, backsliding daughter? You trusted in her treasures, saying, ‘Who will come to me?’
verses.ct: Why do you brag about your valleys — your fertile, flowing valley, you unfaithful people? You trusted in your wealth and said, 'Who would dare attack me?'

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord GOD of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.
verses.web: Behold, I will bring a terror on you,” says the Lord, LORD of Armies, “from all who are around you. All of you will be driven completely out, and there will be no one to gather together the fugitives.
verses.ct: Watch — I am going to bring terror on you from every neighbor around you," declares the Lord GOD of hosts. "Each of you will be scattered in every direction, and no one will gather the refugees back together."

verses.kjv: And afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “But afterward I will reverse the captivity of the children of Ammon,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "But afterward, I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Concerning Edom, thus saith the LORD of hosts; Is wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?
verses.web: Of Edom, LORD of Armies says: “Is wisdom no more in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom vanished?
verses.ct: About Edom, the LORD of hosts says: "Is there no wisdom left in Teman? Have the wise lost all good judgment? Has their insight completely disappeared?

verses.kjv: Flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I will visit him.
verses.web: Flee! Turn back! Dwell in the depths, inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau on him when I visit him.
verses.ct: Run! Turn around and hide deep underground, people of Dedan! I am going to bring disaster on Esau's descendants — the time has come for me to punish them.

verses.kjv: If grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, they will destroy till they have enough.
verses.web: If grape gatherers came to you, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? If thieves came by night, wouldn’t they steal until they had enough?
verses.ct: If grape harvesters came to your vineyard, wouldn't they at least leave a few grapes behind? If thieves broke in at night, wouldn't they only steal what they wanted?

verses.kjv: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he is not.
verses.web: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he will not be able to hide himself. His offspring is destroyed, with his brothers and his neighbors; and he is no more.
verses.ct: But I have stripped Esau completely bare. I have exposed every hiding place, and he won't be able to conceal himself. His children are destroyed, along with his relatives and his neighbors. He is gone.

verses.kjv: Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; and let thy widows trust in me.
verses.web: Leave your fatherless children. I will preserve them alive. Let your widows trust in me.”
verses.ct: Leave your orphans with me — I will keep them alive. And let your widows trust in me."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; Behold, they whose judgment was not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; and art thou he that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink of it.
verses.web: For LORD says: “Behold, they to whom it didn’t pertain to drink of the cup will certainly drink; and are you he who will altogether go unpunished? You won’t go unpunished, but you will surely drink.
verses.ct: The LORD says this: "If even those who didn't deserve to drink from the cup of punishment had to drink it, do you really think you'll escape? You won't go unpunished. You will definitely drink from it.

verses.kjv: For I have sworn by myself, saith the LORD, that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.
verses.web: For I have sworn by myself,” says LORD, “that Bozrah will become an astonishment, a reproach, a waste, and a curse. All its cities will be perpetual wastes.”
verses.ct: I have sworn by my own name," says the LORD, "that Bozrah will become a wasteland — an object of horror, disgrace, and cursing. All its towns will lie in ruins forever."

verses.kjv: I have heard a rumour from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent unto the heathen, saying, Gather ye together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.
verses.web: I have heard news from LORD, and an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, “Gather yourselves together! Come against her! Rise up to the battle!”
verses.ct: I have received a message from the LORD: a messenger has been sent to the nations, saying, "Assemble your armies! March against Edom! Prepare for battle!"

verses.kjv: For, lo, I will make thee small among the heathen, and despised among men.
verses.web: “For, behold, I have made you small among the nations, and despised among men.
verses.ct: "I will make you insignificant among the nations, despised by everyone.

verses.kjv: Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, and the pride of thine heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the LORD.
verses.web: As for your terror, the pride of your heart has deceived you, O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, who hold the height of the hill, though you should make your nest as high as the eagle, I will bring you down from there,” says LORD.
verses.ct: The fear you inspire has deceived you, along with the pride in your heart. You live in the clefts of the rock and cling to the mountain heights. But even if you build your nest as high as an eagle's, I will drag you down from there," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Also Edom shall be a desolation: every one that goeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.
verses.web: “Edom will become an astonishment. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished, and will hiss at all its plagues.
verses.ct: "Edom will become so devastated that everyone who passes by will be shocked and will gasp at the extent of its destruction.

verses.kjv: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the LORD, no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.
verses.web: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and its neighbor cities,” says LORD, “no man will dwell there, neither will any son of man live therein.
verses.ct: Just as Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring towns were overthrown," says the LORD, "no one will live there again. Not a single person will settle in it.

verses.kjv: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong: but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?
verses.web: “Behold, he will come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation: for I will suddenly make them run away from it; and whoever is chosen, I will appoint him over it. For who is like me? Who will appoint me a time? Who is the shepherd who will stand before me?”
verses.ct: Watch — like a lion coming up from the thick brush along the Jordan to attack a well-fed flock, I will suddenly chase Edom from its land. And who will I choose to put in charge of it? For who is like me? Who can challenge me? What leader can stand against me?"

verses.kjv: Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD, that he hath taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.
verses.web: Therefore hear the counsel of LORD, that he has taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely they will drag them away, the little ones of the flock. Surely he will make their habitation desolate over them.
verses.ct: So listen to what the LORD has planned against Edom, and what he intends to do to the people of Teman: even the weakest of the enemy will drag them away. Their homeland will be left desolate because of what happens to them.

verses.kjv: The earth is moved at the noise of their fall, at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.
verses.web: The earth trembles at the noise of their fall; there is a cry, the noise which is heard in the Red Sea.
verses.ct: The earth shakes at the sound of their collapse. Their cries of anguish can be heard all the way to the Red Sea.

verses.kjv: Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle, and spread his wings over Bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighty men of Edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
verses.web: Behold, he will come up and fly as the eagle, and spread out his wings against Bozrah. The heart of the mighty men of Edom at that day will be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
verses.ct: Look — the enemy will swoop in and soar like an eagle, spreading its wings over Bozrah. On that day, the bravest warriors of Edom will be gripped with fear like a woman in the agony of childbirth.

verses.kjv: Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad: for they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.
verses.web: Of Damascus: “Hamath is confounded, and Arpad; for they have heard evil news. They have melted away. There is sorrow on the sea. It can’t be quiet.
verses.ct: About Damascus: "Hamath and Arpad are in a panic because they've heard terrible news. They are melting with fear. There is anxiety churning like a restless sea that cannot be calmed.

verses.kjv: Damascus is waxed feeble, and turneth herself to flee, and fear hath seized on her: anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.
verses.web: Damascus has grown feeble, she turns herself to flee, and trembling has seized her. Anguish and sorrows have taken hold of her, as of a woman in travail.
verses.ct: Damascus has lost all strength. She turns to run, but panic has gripped her. Pain and anguish have seized her like a woman in labor.

verses.kjv: How is the city of praise not left, the city of my joy!
verses.web: How is the city of praise not forsaken, the city of my joy?
verses.ct: How can the famous city be abandoned — the city that was once my delight?

verses.kjv: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: Therefore her young men will fall in her streets, and all the men of war will be brought to silence in that day,” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: Her young men will fall dead in her streets, and every soldier will be silenced on that day," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall consume the palaces of Benhadad.
verses.web: “I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it will devour the palaces of Ben Hadad.”
verses.ct: "I will set fire to the walls of Damascus, and it will consume the palaces of Benhadad."

verses.kjv: Concerning Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite, thus saith the LORD; Arise ye, go up to Kedar, and spoil the men of the east.
verses.web: Of Kedar, and of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck. LORD says: “Arise, go up to Kedar, and destroy the children of the east.
verses.ct: About Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon defeated — the LORD says: "Get up! March against Kedar! Destroy the people of the east!

verses.kjv: Their tents and their flocks shall they take away: they shall take to themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry unto them, Fear is on every side.
verses.web: They will take their tents and their flocks. they will carry away for themselves their curtains, all their vessels, and their camels; and they will cry to them, ‘Terror on every side!’
verses.ct: Their enemies will seize their tents and their flocks, carry off their tent curtains, all their goods, and their camels. People will shout at them, 'Terror on every side!'

verses.kjv: Flee, get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the LORD; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.
verses.web: Flee! Wander far off! Dwell in the depths, you inhabitants of Hazor,” says LORD; “for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you, and has conceived a purpose against you.
verses.ct: Run for your lives! Flee far away! Hide deep underground, people of Hazor," says the LORD, "because Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has made plans against you and devised a strategy to destroy you.

verses.kjv: Arise, get you up unto the wealthy nation, that dwelleth without care, saith the LORD, which have neither gates nor bars, which dwell alone.
verses.web: Arise! Go up to a nation that is at ease, that dwells without care,” says LORD; “that has neither gates nor bars, that dwells alone.
verses.ct: Get up! Attack this carefree nation that lives without a worry," says the LORD. "They have no gates or bars to protect them. They live in isolation.

verses.kjv: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter into all winds them that are in the utmost corners; and I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Their camels will be a booty, and the multitude of their livestock a plunder. I will scatter to all winds those who have the corners of their beards cut off; and I will bring their calamity from every side of them,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Their camels will become plunder, and their massive herds will be seized as spoil. I will scatter to the winds those who trim the corners of their beards, and I will bring disaster on them from every direction," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons, and a desolation for ever: there shall no man abide there, nor any son of man dwell in it.
verses.web: Hazor will be a dwelling place of jackals, a desolation forever. No man will dwell there, neither will any son of man live therein.”
verses.ct: Hazor will become a haunt for jackals, a wasteland forever. No one will live there; not a single person will settle in it."

verses.kjv: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
verses.ct: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet about Elam, early in the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.
verses.web: “LORD of Armies says: ‘Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "I am going to break the bow of Elam — the source of their greatest strength.

verses.kjv: And upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.
verses.web: I will bring on Elam the four winds from the four quarters of the sky, and will scatter them toward all those winds. There will be no nation where the outcasts of Elam will not come.
verses.ct: I will unleash winds against Elam from all 4 corners of the sky and scatter its people in every direction. There won't be a single nation on earth where Elam's refugees haven't fled.

verses.kjv: For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life: and I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, saith the LORD; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:
verses.web: I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before those who seek their life. I will bring evil on them, even my fierce anger,’ says LORD; ‘and I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them.
verses.ct: I will shatter Elam's courage before their enemies — before everyone who wants them dead. I will bring disaster on them, fueled by my fierce anger," says the LORD. "I will send the sword after them until I have completely destroyed them.

verses.kjv: And I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence the king and the princes, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from there king and princes,’ says LORD.
verses.ct: I will set my throne in Elam and wipe out its king and officials," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: But it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring again the captivity of Elam, saith the LORD.
verses.web: ‘But it will happen in the latter days that I will reverse the captivity of Elam,’ says LORD.”
verses.ct: "But in the days to come, I will restore the fortunes of Elam," says the LORD.
